Others: Desmond Bane returned to action after missing one game due to a left ankle sprain.

Bane scored 16 points on efficient shooting (6-of-10 from the field, 2-of-5 from three), adding four rebounds, four assists, and two steals in 27 minutes during a close 119-115 loss to the Houston Rockets.
His return couldn’t have come at a better time for Memphis, currently third in the Western Conference with a 24-14 record.
Over his last 10 games, Bane has averaged 20.9 points, 6.5 assists, 5.6 rebounds, and 1.7 steals in 30.1 minutes per game.
Though the Grizzlies fell to Houston, Bane’s presence is a major boost as they push for the playoffs and improve their standings.
His consistency on both ends is vital for a team fighting for a top spot in the West.
